root.text: <p class="MsoNormal"><span lang="EN-US"><h3>Honda Pilot Ex:&nbsp;</h3></span></p><p class="MsoNormal"><span lang="EN-US">Base price: $29,270; Engine: 3.5-liter, 240-h.p.V-6; Fuel economy: 17 m.p.g. city/22 highway. Rides and handles more like a sedan than a sport-ute. Absorbs bumps in the road and sits flat in tight corners. Same 3.5-liter V-6 with 5-speed automatic as the Acura MDX from which it is derived. Smooth, commotion-free acceleration but not overly energetic, a concession to mileage over muscle. All-wheel-drive. Three rows of seats, but third row for munchkins. Nine cupholders, four power plugs, four pop down grocery bag holders, four cargo net holders standard, one fast food sauce packet holder and one pair of sunglasses holder, but power sunroof not even an option.</span></p><p class="MsoNormal"></p><div style="text-align: right;"><span lang="EN-US">Mateja, Jim</span><br><span lang="EN-US">Tribune News Service</span><br><span lang="EN-US">October 11, 2002</span><br><span lang="EN-US"></span></div><p class="MsoNormal"><span lang="EN-US"><br> </span></p>
